name: Vruivtk
tagline: Application demonstrating the use of vtkRenderingExternal module to render VTK objects in the VRUI context
body:
### Welcome to VruiVTK
This application demonstrates use of the new vtkRenderingExternal module for VRUI and VTK integration.

### Supported Operating Systems
* Linux
* Mac OSX

### Prerequisites
NOTE: To build VruiVTK along with all its prerequisites, simply build the superbuild from [VruiVTKSuperbuild](https://github.com/vruivtk/Vruivtksuperbuild)

VruiVTK application requires the following software to be built and installed.
* [CMake](http://cmake.org)
* [Vrui](http://idav.ucdavis.edu/~okreylos/ResDev/Vrui/)
* [VTK with the vtkRenderingExternal module turned ON](https://github.com/sankhesh/VTK/tree/Rendering_External_Module)
* [TCLAP](http://tclap.sourceforge.net/) 

### Clone VruiVTK source
The VruiVTK application can be built from source obtained using one of the download links on this page or using the commandline as follows:

``
$ git clone https://github.com/VruiVTK/VruiVTK.git
``

The above command creates a directory _VruiVTK_ with the source code.

### Configure Instructions
Configure the build using CMake.

Set the following CMake variables:
```
* VRUI_PKGCONFIG - Path to pkgconfig directory of your VRUI installation
* VTK_DIR - Path to the VTK build directory
* TCLAP_INCLUDE_DIR - Path to include directory of your TCLAP installation
```

Once all the required variables are set, press `generate` to generate the makefile.

### Build Instructions
Build using the make tool.

```
$ make
```

### Run VruiVTK
The build step will create an executable _VruiVTK_ under the build directory that can be used to run the application.
To get usage instructions for the application:

```
$ VruiVTK --help
```
To render an OBJ file using VTK, use the '-f' or '--fileName' argument.
```
$ VruiVTK -f cow-nonormals.obj
```
The following image shows VTK rendering an OBJ dataset in the VRUI context. The dataset was obtained from [here](http://groups.csail.mit.edu/graphics/classes/6.837/F03/models/cow-nonormals.obj).
![VruiVTK with VTK Cow OBJ](https://drive.google.com/file/d/0Bxgq5zla1NcFVVpIckZ5TF8tTjA/edit?usp=sharing)

If no arguments are provided, the application will bring up a VRUI window with a vtkCube rendered at its origin.
![VruiVTK with vtkCube](https://drive.google.com/file/d/0Bxgq5zla1NcFaWtGTzRoZEg4SHc/edit?usp=sharing)
